Fields.DialogueText: Well, would you look at that. That's quite a necklace you've got on.
Oh, Captain, stop! You big flatterer, haha. This is just a little something I had picked up last time we made port.
Looks like a lot more than a little something - it looks like it must've cost a fortune!
Well, I wouldn't be caught dead wearing something cheap.

Fields.MenuText: How expensive was it, exactly?
However much it cost, it was worth it. You look great.
I've never been too big on jewelry, but it doesn't look half bad.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, calm down, Captain. I paid for it myself. Tsh, I'm more responsible than that.
Flattery is unnecessary, but accurate. I saw it and just knew it would perfectly accentuate this dress I've had my eye on.
It better not. I paid a small fortune for it. I personally think it looks fantastic.
So I take it you have a taste for the expensive things in life?
I prefer to think of it as a taste for the, ah, finer things in life. They just usually happen to cost a little more.
*ALARM*
I guess that explains why you're no fan of Morganas.
They certainly are NOT one of those finer things.
Which is why they're free and plentiful, I suppose...
@BATTLE
You're still doing this? I would've figured you'd at least have ripped all the leather off the floor by now.
There's quite a lot of it!
But look, it's a little grimy, but with a little polish the floor will look as good as new! Don't you think?

Fields.MenuText: Honestly, I couldn't care less how it looks.
Knowing you, you'll have it spotless in no time.
What are you doing with all that leather?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, luckily, I care enough for the both of us.
Well, I'm no maid, but I do know how to make something look good.
Oh, don't worry about that. It's just sitting in storage for now. I assume I'll have to put it all back after.
What are you doing all this for? Are you still intent on keeping me in the dark?
For now. It's more fun that way. Don't you like surprises, Captain?
It depends on the surprise.
*ALARM*
Morganas, for example, are surprises I'm not a fan of.
Well, at least we share that sentiment.
@BATTLE
Captain, have you noticed anything odd about the troops we're transporting?
Odd? What do you mean?
I'm not sure...

Fields.MenuText: Oh, maybe they're actually all dead, and we're transporting ghosts!
I'm sure you're just worrying over nothing, Mary.
Well, talk it out. What's not sitting right with you?

Fields.DialogueText: Ghosts, Captain? What are you, five?
Well, it's not that I'm worried, it's just...
They're too... quiet, I guess.
Our previous transport was so rowdy and obnoxious, but these troops are nice and polite, and that hardly makes any sense at all.
Okay, what's the problem? Doesn't that sound like a reason to celebrate?
Why are they so courteous though? Are these kinds of soldiers more common, or are they the exception to the rule?
Mary, just enjoy it while it lasts. I'm sure the next troops we transport will have their own batch of curiosities.
*ALARM*
And that's our cue to start worrying about something else.
Mm. I suppose you're right. Maybe I just haven't grasped all the oddities of troop transport yet.
@BATTLE
Mary, why are we speeding away from the Morganas?
I... didn't think you'd mind, Captain. After all, we have a mission to complete, and going out of our way to engage the enemy will only slow us down.
I thought you were over your fears. We can handle a few Morganas.
I know that... I'm not really scared, I just don't want to take any unnecessary risks.

Fields.MenuText: It's a necessary risk. Every Morgana we destroy is one less Morgana on the seas.
I suppose I understand that. No need to fight every Morgana we see.
You sure you're not just a scaredy cat?

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose that... makes sense. Why do you always have to make sense?
Exactly. We'd never get anywhere if we stopped to fight everything along the way.
Scoff! I'm certainly not. I would just rather get to our destination on time.
You know, I'm just making sure that you're not still worried about dying in battle.
Well... I can't say I don't think about it anymore, but... I'm mostly over it.
*BOOM*
What was that?!
Oh no. It looks like we sped right from one group of Morganas and into another.
Better sound the alarm. Can't run from every fight, Mary.
Clearly.
@BATTLE
We are moving so much faster than I was expecting, Mary. Excellent work.
It's easy when you're me. And when the sea cooperates with you. On beautiful days like this it reminds me why sea travel is the superior form of transportation.
What about air travel?
Psh! Passing fad. Ocean liners will always be the best choice for international travel. I mean, look at this view - you're not going to get this up in the clouds.

Fields.MenuText: I agree, there's just something pleasant about sailing the seas.
Air travel is just faster. Speed over comfort.
They both have their strengths and weaknesses.

Fields.DialogueText: That's my captain. You've got your head screwed on straight.
Fine, you take your planes and get there fast. Just don't come whining to me when you're wrapped up in a fiery pile of wreckage when you arrive.
That's no choice at all. You need to learn to choose a side, Captain.
*ALARM*
Damn, and we were moving so fast too.
I suppose I'd better slow us down. Unless you'd like to try and sail right past them.
Not this time, Mary.
I didn't think so.
@BATTLE
Hey, Mary, I've been meaning to ask about that ribbon you're always wearing for a while now.
Oh, you mean this? It's the Blue Riband. It's awarded to the passenger liner with the highest record speed. Meaning me.
So that's why you're so proud of your speed.
Well, of course. I earned the right to boast a little.

Fields.MenuText: Is that really such a big deal?
Sounds pretty important, I understand why you wear it around all the time.
You know, it kind of clashes with your outfit.

Fields.DialogueText: It's a huge deal. There's a trophy and everything.
Exactly. If I could wear the trophy around all the time too, I would. But it's a little big for a proper accessory.
Please, pride goes with everything. And nothing brings me more pride than this and the trophy that came with it.
There's a trophy, too?
There wasn't always, but there is now. And now it's mine. And it's going to stay that way this time.
Sounds like there's a story there. I didn't realize you were so competitive.
I don't want to talk about it. I can get ruthless. And that's just an ugly colour on me.
*ALARM*
Not as ugly as that.
It's hard to compete with Morganas when it comes to hideousness.
@BATTLE
We'll be reaching our destination shortly, Captain. Then we can unload these troops.
And you don't sound pleased about that why?
Well, transporting these troops has been... well, really easy. It's felt kind of like a vacation.
Getting a little worn out, Mary?
Can you blame me? I wasn't built for this kind of life. I was built for pleasure cruises. It's a bit of a strain. I could use a pleasure cruise myself, right about now.

Fields.MenuText: Well, you can take as long of a vacation as you like. After the war.
Maybe we can find some down time soon. We all could use a bit of a break, I'm sure.
A Belle on a cruise... That's an odd thought.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, I know. War this, war that. I really despise war. It ruins everything.
Really? Don't get my hopes up, Captain. I'll never forgive you.
Then don't think about it too much. It just sounded like a nice vacation idea to me.
You're not going to break down on me anytime soon, are you?
Don't worry, Captain. I'll be fine. Just this complaining  is already helping.
Is that all it takes?
It's a start.
*ALARM*
Well, it sounds like you'll have a lot more to complain about now.
Never say that like it's a good thing, Captain.
@BATTLE
I see you finally got all this leather off.
Yes, no thanks to you.
You could've helped, you know.

Fields.MenuText: You could've asked.
It seemed like you had it under control.
Why would I help you dismantle part of the ship?

Fields.DialogueText: I shouldn't have had to. A proper officer would have offered to aid a lady in need.
Well, you're not wrong. But I could've gotten it done faster with a little help.
I... Technically that's not wrong, but... it was ugly. It had to go.
So will you tell me what you're planning for this room now?
Well... maybe I should. I was going to need your aid eventually.
Stop beating around the bush, Mary.
Okay, fine. I'd like to throw a little party on board, Captain. An elegant gala of sorts.
A gala? I'm going to need more details than that.
*ALARM*
Oh, look at that. Morganas interrupt us again. I'd be more than happy to continue this conversation, but we'd have to run from these little pests.
Tempting, but we can finish this talk after the battle.
@BATTLE
Captain, you rang?
I thought now was as good a time as any to get some more details about this little shindig you've got up your sleeves.
First of all, don't ever use that word again. It makes it sound like some hillbilly wedding!
Ha! Okay, fine, just fill me in.
Well, there's been some effort in recent weeks to arrange a new diplomatic summit - a forum for the great and the good to discuss matters about our new Morgana threat.
Right. And coordination has been problematic. I don't know why they don't all just go back to Zurich, but...
But that's where we come in! I want The Queen Mary to be location for this event.

Fields.MenuText: It's not really a party situation. It's an important diplomatic meeting.
That... doesn't sound like the worst plan. It could be considered a more neutral location. We're not a warship.
I hope you have a Plan B, because I don't see that happening.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, I understand that, but important people have important friends, and maybe if this meeting didn't sound so dreadful they'd be more likely to actually show up.
My thinking exactly. Besides, who would miss out on the chance to attend a gala on The Queen Mary? My soirees were practically famous before the war started.
Oh don't be such a stick in the mud. This could totally work. I meant, it couldn't hurt to ask.
I can handle the party preparations on my own. What I need you to do is find out if our superiors would even go for it.
I suppose I can send a letter or two. We'll see what happens.
Perfect, Captain. This is going to be magnificent!
@BATTLE
Captain, have you heard about this insanity going on with the other Belles?
What are you talking about, Mary? If Belles were going insane, I think I'd have heard about it.
Well, maybe they're not going insane, but they're acting rather foolish. I've heard of a few Belles that have started some competition. See which Belle can defeat the most Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, that doesn't sound insane at all. There's nothing wrong with a little healthy competition.
That is crazy. This isn't the time for some weird contest. This is war.
Really? How many Belles are getting in on this?

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose not. A little competition can fuel the fires that could very well turn the tide of this war in our favor.
Exactly. And this competition could very easily get in the way of my plans. I don't want that to happen.
I'm not sure, honestly. I'd like to believe that the majority of Belles see this as childish, like myself.
*ALARM*
Eeeek! That horrible thing always catches me off-guard!
We'd better start getting ready for battle.
I don't suppose there's any way we could...
No running, Mary.
I didn't think so.
Hmmm. Maybe I could use this competition to our advantage.
@BATTLE
Mary, I wanted to tell you some good news.
Oh? Did they agree to my gala idea?
You're right, that would be better news. But, no. The crew entered you into that Morgana-defeating competition the Belles are having - and the more I think about it, the smarter I think it is.
What? Why?

Fields.MenuText: It should be good for morale.
I wanted to see that ruthless side of you.
I thought it would help you get over your fears.

Fields.DialogueText: Whose morale, exactly? I'm not exactly built for competitions like this!
Why would you want to see that? It's a hideous side of me I'd rather no one ever see!
I'm not... Okay... I suppose that makes a little sense, but you could have at least warned me or asked me about it first.
Look, we've already sent messages to the other Belles, so as far as they're concerned you're in the contest. So let's see if we can at least place.
This is one of your more horrible ideas, Captain.
Maybe, but think about that trophy we could win.
Trophy?
Apparently first place gets some kind of prize. I just assumed it was a trophy.
Well... I suppose keeping track of how many Morganas I destroy isn't the worst thing in the world.
@BATTLE
We've got a whole bunch of Morganas approaching us. It might actually be a smart move to run this time, Mary.
Oh, please - we'll be running all right. Running circles around those idiotic beasts that think they can make us their prey.
Whoa. I never thought I'd hear something like that out of you.
Hold my earrings, Captain. Actually, my shoes too. This is gonna get messy as all hell!
@BATTLE
Mary, that was... impressive. To say the least.
Ahem, excuse me... I never meant for you to see that side of me.

Fields.MenuText: It was a little scary, but effective.
You scared the hell out of me, but you obliterated  those Morganas!
I've seen a hell of a lot worse than that.

Fields.DialogueText: A little scary? I feel like you're being kind.
Yes, but at what cost? I'm worried you'll never look at me the same way again.
I doubt that. I'm almost as bad as those Morganas when my blood starts pumping like that.
I'm sorry, Captain. I just hate who I become when I get too competitive.
You're still the same Mary to me.
That's kind of you to say. Now let's get a tally of those Morganas before we forget.
Look at them go, Captain. I suppose I shouldn't be surprised that they're not running all over themselves to get off the ship like the previous troops.
It makes sense. They were pretty courteous throughout the entire voyage.
Hmmm... I'm going to miss them. I'm not looking forward to whatever brutes we pick up next.
You don't know. They could be even more pleasant.
I won't get my hopes up.

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, that's probably smart.
Keep hope. It's important.
Well, I'll keep my fingers crossed anyway.

Fields.DialogueText: And I try to be as intelligent as I can.
Okay, fine, I'll keep a little hope.
Is that supposed to do something? I don't feel any different.
*ALARM*
Morganas? Get these troops off the ship. I've got some points to score.
I may have created a monster...
@BATTLE
All right, Captain.
Yes?
Where are we heading to get our next batch of troops for transport?

Fields.MenuText: You're that eager for a new assignment?
I don't know. What are you looking at me for?
Could you be any less enthusiastic?

Fields.DialogueText: No. I'd just really rather get it over with.
You're the captain. You're supposed to know these things.
If you want me to be more enthusiastic, give me a more enticing assignment. You know the one I have in mind.
So where are we going? Seriously.
Actually, we're not going too far. It seems like our transports are being held for the moment.
What? Why? Were they unhappy with my performance? No, that couldn't be it.
Well, it seems like they want to give us enough time to prepare for this gala of yours. They're expecting quite a bit out of you.
Wait... are you saying what I think you're saying?
All sides agreed to hold this little meeting here. The Queen Mary is getting dressed to the nines again.
This is going to be the greatest event ever! It's going to be glorious. I can scarcely wait!
Well, it's still just a boring diplomatic gathering. How exciting can it be?
You leave that to me.
@BATTLE
Enemy inbound! Full speed ahead!
@BATTLE
I didn't expect Morganas to attack us so close to port.

Fields.MenuText: Neither did I. I guess they're just tricky like that.
You have to expect Morganas around every corner. They could be anywhere! At any time!
Can't you sense them, though?

Fields.DialogueText: Tricky, sneaky, evil... They're despicable.
Well... Not just anywhere. I mean, I doubt they'll be showing up in my closet anytime soon.
Well... It's not infallible. I'm not exactly that good at it, if I'm being honest.
I guess it's just lucky that we were here.
I still would have prefered to be somewhere else.
Hey, where'd that bloodthirsty Morgana killer go?
The other Belles have such higher scores than I do. It hardly seems worth putting my life on the line for a competition I'm going to lose.
Then how about to protect innocent civilians?
... Well, there's that too, of course! I just mean I'm... You know what I meant!
So, how do you think it looks? A lot better than that leather-covered mess, right? Much more elegant.
I have to admit, it's come a long way. But...
But? But what?

Fields.MenuText: But nothing. You've done a wonderful job, Mary.
But I kind of liked the leather. It was comfy.
But it seems like a whole lot of effort for just one party.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you. I have, haven't I? Still, it's not quite perfect yet.
You liked the leather? Well, there's about a mountain of it in storage - you can go to town on it.
I don't ever do anything halfway. And I'm nowhere near finished with my preparations.
Let's see... we have the tables ready, the floors are shining- Oh, we need a chandelier!
A chandelier? Seriously?
They're the absolute picture of elegance. We simply must have one.
Aren't those usually pretty expensive?
All the more reason.
*ALARM*
We can talk more about this after we deal with that.
Okay, but I should warn you - it's already been decided.
@BATTLE
Hey, Mary, what do you think about taking a break from all this party planning and going on a patrol? I'm getting a little stir crazy.
Ugh, just go without me.
Uh, not really an option. You kind of come with the ship. What's up?
The other Belles have defeated so many more Morganas than me. Why should I even bother?

Fields.MenuText: What about just for fun?
You're giving up? That doesn't sound like you.
It's not over until it's over. We've still got time to raise your score.

Fields.DialogueText: Fun? Risking my life fighting Morganas isn't my idea of fun. Far from it, in fact.
This competition was just unfair from the start. It's not giving up if I never had a chance.
And how do you plan on doing that? For every Morgana I defeat, they blow up five. This isn't my kind of contest.
Maybe this is just your fear talking.
No, this is sense talking. I'm making perfect sense for any logical person.
I'm just saying maybe your score would be higher if you weren't holding back. Take some more risks.
I take plenty of risks...
Then let's go on patrol and prove it.
...Fine. Let's.
@BATTLE
Mary, I just learned we changed our course. Where are we going?
We're going to go and prove a point.
What are you talking about?
What you said before, about my fears keeping me from matching victory for victory with the other Belles... you were right, but I'm no coward.
I never said you--
Excuse me, I didn't finish speaking.
... Go on?

Well, I'm no coward. One of the officers told me about a Morgana that's been attacking merchant ships nearby. I may not have defeated as many Morganas as the other Belles, but I can definitely do this.

Fields.MenuText: You don't have to prove anything, Mary.
Hmmm, I like what you're saying, Mary. Lead the way.
Sounds like some nice last words.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe not to you, but... sometimes a lady has to prove things to herself.
I'm glad you're on board with the plan, Captain, because it's a little late to turn back now.
Don't try to scare me, Captain. I've made my decision. I'm a Belle. I can do this... I can do this...
*ALARM*
There it is.
That is some Morgana.
It won't be for long.
Confidence is a nice colour on you.
@BATTLE
Mary? Hello? Anyone home, Mary?
Oh, Captain? I'm, er, sorry. I was just kind of daydreaming about the party.
I could see that. You were kind of dancing in place. It's looking nice in here.
Yes, it's all coming together. We'll be ready in time, though I expect something of a mad dash at the end.
I was never worried about not being ready. You know what you're doing.
Well, thank you for the faith. I just wish I could stop daydreaming. It's distracting me.
What exactly are you daydreaming about?
Just silliness. I mean... there's no chance that a flock of celebrities will be attending, is there?

Fields.MenuText: Probably not. It's diplomats and their staff. Could be on the dull side, frankly.
Uh... Maybe? I mean... I don't know. I don't have a lot of experience with celebrities.
A flock? Is that really what a group of celebrities is called? I would've guessed it'd be a pride.

Fields.DialogueText: You keep saying that. I'm going to prove you wrong. This is going to be the party of the year. That way, all the celebrities will want to come to my next one.
Good point. You're probably not the best person to ask...
Ha! That works too. In fact, it works a little better. I might borrow that.
I suppose if I wanted celebrities to show up, we should've been docked in California. One day.
*ALARM*
Mary, I think you might be daydreaming again. We've got Morganas.
Yes, I know. I might like my daydreams, but I can't block something like that out...
@BATTLE
Well...?
Well, that's that.
The contest has been decided.

Fields.MenuText: Who won?
I'm guessing by that tone that we didn't do too well.
Already? But we were just really getting into it!

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know. Does it matter? Some Belle that's obviously better than I am. I didn't care to learn her name.
We didn't. I didn't even place. It wasn't even close...
Maybe we were, but the rest of the Belles had one hell of a head start.
I'm glad it's over. That contest was silly anyway. It was just a distraction.
We'll do better next time.
... I'm going to destroy next time. Maybe we should look into getting bigger guns...
Hey, look on the bright side. We might not have won, but we did destroy that monster aircraft carrier. That counts for something.
I guess... it was pretty strong.
Yeah, and you took her on without even a second thought. I was very impressed.
I did do that, didn't I?
You did. And that's a victory in my book.
*ALARM*
Well... let's keep it up. Let's take care of a few more Morganas. They won't be anything compared to that other one.
That's the kind of attitude I like to hear.
@BATTLE
You know, now that the competition is over, I guess you'll be spending most of your time up here, huh?
That implies that I haven't already been spending most of my time here. I've even spent entire nights making sure everything was on track.
Now that's dedication. Is there anything I should be doing?
Just make sure you look nice for the big day. I don't need you dressed like a homeless person when...
When what?
Oh, good God! I haven't even thought about what I'm going to wear! How could I have forgotten?! It's the most important part!

Fields.MenuText: You're not exactly wrong. What were you going to do, wear a garbage bag?
Is it really so important? I mean, clothes are clothes, right?
Yeah, but what am I going to wear?

Fields.DialogueText: No! Obviously not. I just wouldn't have had enough time to properly consider my options.
Clothes are clothes? Who raised you and where did they go wrong?
Oh, you'll figure it out. I'm the bigger problem here. This is going to take some serious time and effort.
*ALARM*
Oh, great. More Morganas.
Can you take care of that? I've got bigger issues.
No, you don't, Mary. Morganas are more important than your outfit.
You say that now, but if I look horrible for the party I'm blaming you and these damned Morganas.
@BATTLE
Okay, give me a second. This dress is a bit complicated.
I'll wait right here. I still don't understand why you need my opinion on what you're wearing.
Isn't that obvious? It's because I trust you, Captain. Your opinion has proven invaluable to me.
Really?
Well, yes. I mean, you can be annoying, and a pain, but only rarely. I have a lot to thank you for.
Without you I'd never have faced my fears, my dining room would still be covered in that hideous leather, and I'd never have gotten this chance to throw another party.
Well, putting it like that, you're going to make me blush.
I'm just trying to say that I'm glad you're my captain. You can infuriate me sometimes, but we're a good fit.
Right. How do I look?

Fields.MenuText: You look amazing.
It looks better than that last dress.
It looks fine, I guess. Dresses aren't my thing.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes. You have a good eye.
Honestly, I agree. This one just feels right.
There's that annoying part again. Though I appreciate your opinion all the same.
I guess that settles it. I've got my outfit for the party all planned out.
*ALARM*
We're really going to have to do something about that, Captain.
You mean turn off the alarm? Not going to happen.
No. We're going to have to do something about the Morganas. We can't let them interrupt the party.
Oh... you make a point. We'll figure something out.
I hope you're right. Let's go.
Aren't you going to change?
Are you kidding? As complicated as this is to put on, it's even harder to take off. We'd be here all day. We don't have that kind of time.
@BATTLE
Enemy spotted! I have full faith in you, Captain!
@BATTLE
I really hope that's all of them. I feel like we've been out here all day!
Well, we have to make sure the party isn't interrupted. We all know Morganas have simply abysmal timing.

Fields.MenuText: I can't argue with that.
Personally, I like it when Morganas pop up. They break up the monotony of the day.
It could be worse. They could be falling upon us like rain.

Fields.DialogueText: Right? It's like they know when they're least welcome.
So a day with just me and no Morganas is monotonous? You sure know how to make a girl feel appreciated.
I suppose you have a point. Facing a barrage of Morganas seems like an absolute nightmare.
Seriously, though. That had to be the last of them, right?
If you have to ask the question, then we're not finished yet. This is an extermination effort.
You know we can't just eradicate the Morganas. They'll swarm back in before long.
You're not wrong, but I can cross my fingers, hoping that peace will last for at least one party. Just one night.
All right, let's find that last morsel of Morganas. Lead the way, Mary.
I think I know exactly where they're hiding. But I'm pretty sure there are a lot of them.
I'm sure we can take them on. I guess we'll find out soon.
@BATTLE
Captain! There you are! I've been looking all over for you.
Oh, I appreciate the dress uniform, you look positively dashing.
Thank you. I appreciate the vote of confidence.
How are you enjoying your first official event aboard the Queen Mary?

Fields.MenuText: It's my ship, doesn't feel much different except for all the strangers aboard.
It's hard to believe that you turned that ugly, leather-covered mess into this extravagant hall. I'm impressed.
This looks expensive. I'm not going to get some kind of extravagant bill on my desk tomorrow, am I?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, actually, we have strangers on board all the time. They're just usually in uniform.
Thank you. Maybe you'll let me do a little more decorating. I have been adding some color to that garish grey paint on the hull.
No, don't worry about it. It might look like this cost an exorbitant amount of money, but I have my ways of negotiating.
You know, I think everyone is having a pretty good time. I'm glad we got that chandelier installed in time. And the food. Mary, the food!
I'm glad you're enjoying yourself. I wanted this to be a party for all the guests to enjoy, and even if you're the captain, you're still a guest.
I guess I can take one night off. Especially if I get to enjoy these finger foods.
What did you just say? How dare you speak to me like that?!
I'll speak to you any way I like. I have a long memory and I know how to hold a grudge!
Well, it seems like I'm the only one not taking a night off. I think that's the third argument I've stumbled into tonight.
Almost makes you miss transporting soldiers, huh?
Still, I like to think the party's helping a little.
It's helping me. And my stomach.
Seriously, as far as I'm concerned, you're working miracles here.
I will neither confirm nor deny.
I'll settle for keeping the peace...
I am ready... to take these shoes off. And burn them.
Heels are murder, huh?
If your feet aren't killing you by the end of a party, you weren't doing it right. You've got to make sure to make a meaningful memory with each of your guests.

Fields.MenuText: You and I have very different ways of partying.
That's an interesting way to think about it. Is that how you make a lasting impression?
If you make a meaningful memory with everyone, then are any of them really meaningful?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, we can't all be happy eating alone in the corner while everyone else is having a good time.
Yes, and it's also how you make connections. The trick is to make people remember your name. It works in business and in politics.
Don't get all philosophical on me. I could argue all day with you, but I'm already exhausted.
It was a good party. Think their ''meeting'' went as well as the festivities?
Actually, I helped organize quite a few talks off to the side of the main action. There was some harsh language here and there, but overall I think everyone got what they needed.
That's good to hear. I'm glad I wasn't the only one to get what they wanted.
And what did you want?
